items.name: Squadron Supreme Vol. 1: The Pre-War Years Premiere (Hardcover)
Squadron Supreme Vol. 1: The Pre-War Years Premiere (2006)

wiki.identity: Publicly known to the people of Earth-712
wiki.occupation: Adventurer, public champion; (Formerly) government agent, oceanographer
wiki.citizenship: United States of America of Earth-712
wiki.abilities: Amphibian is very well versed in oceanography and marine biology.
wiki.powers: Amphibian is adapted to living in and out of water. He can breathe water as well as breathing oxygen. His body changes to adapt itself to various depths and pressures underwater. The deeper he goes the stronger he gets and the tougher his skin becomes. Amphibian can also see through the murky depths of the ocean and has some form of telepathy allowing him to communicate with marine life such as dolphins. He can presumably travel at great speeds while in the water, but the exact speed is unknown. Outside of water Amphibian has superhuman strength allowing him to lift ten tons and his skin is superhumanly tough.
wiki.bio_text: Kingsley Rice was born a [[Glossary:M#mutant|mutant]], able to survive in and out of water. As Amphibian, he was one of the founding members of the [[Squadron Supreme (Earth-712)|Squadron Supreme]]. Amphibian resigned in protest over the Squadron's behavior modification program and chose to live underwater where he was completely uninvolved and unaware of the surface world.
wiki.bio:
Kingsley Rice was born a [[Glossary:M#mutant|mutant]], able to survive in and out of water. As Amphibian, he was one of the founding members of the [[Squadron Supreme (Earth-712)|Squadron Supreme]]. Amphibian resigned in protest over the Squadron's behavior modification program and chose to live underwater where he was completely uninvolved and unaware of the surface world.

When the Squadron returned from their adventures in [[Earth-616]], they set about reuniting all of the surviving founders of the Squadron. [[Power Princess (Earth-712)|Power Princess]] brought Amphibian back to [[Utopia Isle]] where he rejoined the Squadron. Amphibian went with the Squadron to attack the [[Global Directorate (Earth-712)|Global Directorate]], and were joined by [[Nighthawk (Neal Richmond) (Earth-712)|Neal Richmond]], the new Nighthawk.

Amphibian and the Squadron continued their battle against the Global Directorate and were on the verge of being captured by the Global Directorate's Blue Eagles when [[Proteus (House of M)|Proteus]] arrived on Utopia Isle having run from the [[Exiles]]. Proteus (in the body of [[Marvel 2099 (Earth-928)|Earth-928]]'s [[Hulk (2099)|Hulk]]) quickly helped the Squadron Supreme defeat the Blue Eagle troops and convinced the Squadron to attack the Exiles when they arrived. Proteus then teleported to another reality while the Exiles arrived on [[Earth-712]]. The Exiles were quickly defeated by the Squadron and were put on trial for supposed crimes against the multiverse. Amphibian and the Squadron were shown the truth of the Exiles mission by [[Sasquatch (Exiles)|Heather Hudson]] who used the [[Timebroker (Exiles)|Timebroker]] interface. Hudson also showed Amphibian and the Squadron the truth of the Global Directorate's rise to power, and the Exiles helped the Squadron overthrow the Global Directorate's oligarchy.
